Review: Been holding off reviewing this one because I was going back and forth on considering it a straight up light beer, which I rated it as. It is jut below poor and at the high end of terrible. It is extremely watery and flat tasting. If I were to rank it as a low calorie brew and solely as such, I would rank it at about 2.5. Halfway between poor and average

Look - very pale/clear.

Smell - you ever smell a used beer can that you found on the ground when you were a kid? That's what this smells like.

Taste - fizzy and watery. It literally is reminiscent of tonic water or soda. Very carbonated.

Feel - worse than the taste or the smell is the feel. It's so bubbly and carbonated on your pallette it feels like a Sprite.

Overall - look, any beer that has it's caloric intake in it's name wasn't made to be good. If you're on a diet that restricts how many calories you consume this is a decent replacement for a regular light beer (Miller lite, Bud light, Coors light). The reviews of those beers will let you know you're just substituting terrible beers with a really watered down terrible beer though.

Had one at the golf course, and while it wasn't that great it was better than I thought it would be--good enough, I feel for a short review. So here's the review:

Pretty much indistinguishable from Miller Lite.

That's sort of impressive, considering its caloric lightness (which in beers such as Michelob Ultra and the other Miller 64 create a weird aroma that's like dirty socks). Grainy start, and a hoppy finish that is light but still discernibly hoppy. Totally drinkable.

Super straw yellow color, the usual mixture of a ton of a water and very little barley. Flimsy white head props up and hits the bricks right quick. Aroma of almost nothing.

Taste of almost nothing. Highly carbonated and watery. On the plus side, you can drink this and hydrate, without worrying about the water quality from some 3rd world shithole if you come across this abroad.

I guess there are no off flavors, so in terms of taste you can't dock it too hard, but mouth feel, jeez, its overly carbonated water that had some shitty beer spilled into it.

Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer
Appearance: Light yellow, big white foam
Aroma: scent smell of malt, nothing else
Taste: not really great, watery
Mouth feel: very carbonated
Overall: good beer, repeat: no look for: no
drank:
It's awful. I don't know why I'm even rating it. It can only be beat by Genesee Light, Milwaukee's Best Light, and Kirkland Signature Light. It's just bad.

This was like water in every aspect. MGD is already pretty sketchy. If I want a beer, then I'll have beer. If I want water, I'll have water. Palest straw color. No aroma. Barely any taste. Felt like water.

This CANQuest (tm) originally took place on 05-09-2010.

Another one that I CANnot believe that I have not reviewed previously. Anything in support of the CANQuest, I suppose.

First, let me say that when this first hit the market back in the late-1980's, I was a HUGE fan in its unleaded version. Regular was much better then its High Life counterpart and this beat Lite six ways to and on Sunday. After I toured the Miller plant in MKE for the first time, in 1992, I was hooked. Today? Let's see ...

From the outset, it had both similarities and contrasts with its leaded version (MGD). I got a nice couple of fingers of bone-white head with lousy retention. Samey-same. Color was a paler shade of golden-yellow with NE-quality clarity. Close to samey-same. Nose was still filled with adjuncts, especially corn, but not as prevalent. Pretty much samey-same. Mouthfeel was watery and there was not any real taste. It was so innocuous as to wonder why bother. Finish was mighty tasteless, stripped of any fabric of beer. Colored water. Feh. I might as well have had some water. At least my caloric intake was low. Sheesh.

This one's badge/patch may now be in jeopardy.

Picked this and a can of Bud Select 55 up at a gas station for .50 Cents a piece. Any time I find a beer I haven't had, Even an adjunct, at such a low price, I buy it. Diamonds in the rough do exist.

Look - Drank from the can so I wouldn't know.

Smell - Not much. Metallic and grainy.

Taste - Not THAT bad. Cereal grains and a touch of grape with a slightly bready finish.

Feel - Light watery body with flat carbonation.

Overall - Why bother.

(This is an old review from 2005. I had it for the 99 cal Bud Select but it was this one)

As bad a brew as I've had from one of the major breweries....I thought this would be "added" flavor being it was "select"...it is not....it has little flavor and what flavor it does have is nasty...it literally tastes like I took a glass of water...dropped an ounce of Bud Light into and mixed it up...this has no redeeming qualities. I'd take a host of light beer over this that have more flavor....the worst purchase I have made in many years...stick to regular Bud if you like AB Macros..

If Eberhard and Adolphus rolled out of their grave this would be the first beer they destroyed. It's been said before, but I'll say it again, "If you're counting calories, drink water or switch to vodka."

It's thin, flavorless and odd smelling.
If you're that worried about carbs/calories, drink water, it tastes better.
Definitely not a beer lovers beer.

I like light beers and I’m watching calories. I realize a lot of people hated the taste but I was surprised that this tasted so good to me. Light and crisp and I didn’t feel guilty drinking a couple. I don’t drink a lot so this works for me ! It’s is hard to find bottles and just a 6 pack because it wasn’t popular. I only find it in 24 cans which doesn’t work for me. Bumper

12oz bottle - review from notes

Just watered down bud lite, basically. 2.4% ABV makes me scratch my head in absolute bewilderment: Who in tarnation is this beer for? Near beer that isn't near beer

I just don't get it

Possibly the worst beer I have ever had. The look is light and not very frothy. The taste is sour and actually made me feel on the queasy side. With only 2.4 ABV meaning you would to drink twice as many to get to feeling good makes this beer an even poorer choice. Sure it s lower in carbs and calories but give me a break. I d rather drink NA beer because it tastes better.

Needless to say I will never buy this beer again. To call it a lager is a travesty.

The beer has been unfairly rated and I wanted to clear things up. I’ve been on Keto for a long time now. This is a low carb beer. It’s extremely watery. Think...La Croix: Beer Flavored. However, if you like seltzer water, beer, and watching your calories and carbs...then this beer does it all. Allows you to kick em back during the game with your buddies and not have to get out the carb calculator.

Overall: highly recommended for those who are carb or calorie conscious. But yea, it’s not gonna blow your mind with its hoppy flavor. I’m just happy there IS an option out there like this!

By no means do I think this is a great beer ore even a good beer. What I like about this beer is that you can drink a case of them easily and wake feeling like you didn't drink (speaking from personal experience). Some will love it but it wasn't anything special to me.

Think bud light that has been watered down. Straight piss water. Rain run off that has been filtered through old coins. Extremely light and most definitely crushable but honestly there’s not much to it.

A decent example of a low calorie, low carb beer. Pours a pale yellow color with little head. Aroma is of malt and something vaguely off-putting. The taste is thin and watery, but it is a 55 calorie beer. Mouthfeel is light. With a clean, thin finish. Not a great beer, but it beats drinking water

For what it is, Its surprisingly good. It has a faint smell to it which isnt suprising. It dosent have a strong beer taste, but certainly not a bad taste especially for 55 calories. It could be improved a lot with addition of lime flavoring which could be achieved by adding a slice of lime. It's super crisp and has no bad taste or aftertaste. It's not a beer of beers by all means but its nice for a long session when your trying to watch your calories.

(12 oz clear bottle, freshest before 04NOV19; purchased cold single... poured into 14 oz mug)

L: golden-amber liquid; fizzy white head on pour, immediately collapsed into thin collar... jerking the glass to and fro will leave a brief streak of lace, but it immediately slides away

S: faint honeyish malt syrup, little else - maybe some grain husk?

T: neutered lightly-baked flour product, carbonic bitter finish, odd lightly-sweetened cereal aftertaste... pretty damn bone dry, with a mild paper-bag essence on the palate

F: restrained sudsy sizzle; shapeless, tightly-drawn back-end to the body; vacuum-sucked out finish - rather notable overall tailoring of body and dryness

O: rather drained of flavor with an emaciated body; that noted, the overall taste isn't quite as 'watery' as a Natty Ice (1546)

I spend long days on the beach and this has everything I need/want (refreshing with good beer flavor) and nothing I don’t (high calories and alcohol).
Awesome beer!
Beer snobs will be haters...
Let them hate!

Here's a review of a beer had years ago. Tough to keep track of where your reviews went with so many online beer places these days (and difficult entities that overmod). Pours a similar color to that which you see in the clear bottle. Not a lot of grain here, gotta count those calories. Concentrated urine color, thin head eviscerates itself in the 1/8" range. Barely discernable grain qualities in the nose. Lager yeast not there.

Taste is a highly carbonated light grain meets mineral water qualities. They didn't go hard, or even a below average amount with the hops. I'm sure they used some super high alpha acid no flavor kind. There is no there there. There aren't "off flavors" per se, but there is definitely a lacking of flavor. 2.4% almost makes you wonder 'what's the point'?

Nonetheless, the beer does seem to accomplish what it is going for. Ugh this is one of those double digit positive rate deviations for a beer I don't care for. Oh well.

this is pretty bad, but from an ice cold can, i prefer it to many of its peers in the same segment. its not metallic, its not sweet, its not overly cheap tasting to be honest, and its also not nothing, which counts for me, id rather have a little adjuncty character and a slightly appreciable lager yeast element than no flavor at all, and thats what we have here. drink it fast, because it warms up like garbage, but there are definitely worse beers than this. its not even that watery for how light it is, the high carbonation helps with that. i wouldnt make a day of it, but one in isolation is fine. it does start to taste like the can a little bit towards the bottom, and there is a decided absence of hops, even for the style, but i really cant hate on this too hard. one thing i like about it is that it does sort of taste like a classic bud, albeit a little lesser version, but you can tell its from the same family of lagers, and i find that appealing for some reason as i sip on this. more of a pounder than anything, not as bad as everyone says...

Bought as a single at Old Chicago.

Pours a pale gold, small head of foam.

Smells light..grain, weird malt and hop profile, thank goodness it's light?

Taste offers no positive surprises. Taste is light and rather inoffensive. Grainy, hint of a hint of bitterness. Better than Michelob Ultra...

I love a good full flavored full bodied beer. That being said, I cannot drink like a 21 year old anymore and have some health issues to boot. Bottom line here is that this beer won't kill me. It's low alcohol content allows me to cut my alcohol intake by more than 50%. For what it is, Bud 55 looks, smells and tastes just enough like beer to make it work for me. Am I happy about it? No.

12 oz can
Consumed 21Aug, 2022
Glass: 333mL Pokal [don't make this mistake - drink it out of its can]
Temp at Pour: ice cold


Look:
Clear pale straw yellow that is full of bubbles. Initial 4-finger foamy white head dissipates fairly quickly to a ring-and-island. Good lacing is left along the glass.

Smell:
Very mild but sweet biscuit dough with a noticeable lemon note. There is also a mineral or really a metallic note as well.

Taste:
Faint sweetened corn and light but syrupy malts. The mineral/metallic note from the nose is in the taste. A very mild bitterness shows up quickly. The sip dries out a tad at the end.

Feel:
Quite watery. Well carbonated. Body is very thin.

Overall:
A somewhat passable light AAL. It doesn't really taste like much. But it's cheap, it's beer, and it kinda tastes like beer. Fine for a hot day after mowing the lawn or at the shore (where other beers cost 2-3 times as much). Drink it ice cold, drink it in it's can, and don't let it warm up.

Also known as an "Eastern Shore Cocktail" in parts of Maryland.

Poured from a 25oz can best by December 22 2022

On the pour a surprising fine white 3 finger head formed on a straw body with fine active carbonation. Over a few mi uses the head lost half of its height but I've seen a whole lot worse retention. Some light lacing.

Aroma is bad slightly farty, possibly from crap hops or rushed lager yeast who really knows I could be both based on the smell. Then a light adjunct sweetness mixed with a little BO.

Taste is better than the aroma but a bit of rushed lager funk is still there followed by a light but corny sweetness that fades into vague syrupy light malts. For the most part it tastes like it should.

Feel is a bit uncarbonated at first but then some sort of dryness creeps in and makes you feel like it was carbonated? A bit confusing and not the greatest. Definitely light tho. Medium to short finish.

Overall it is what it is. It's certainly not "good" but I've consumed much more offensive things as well. It's cheap it's beer, and it tastes a bit like beer too.

This is a beer that's a favorite amongst a poor crowd. I can't get drunk with it and all it does is make you have to piss all night long. On top of that it tastes like they used urine instead of hops in the recipe. I think I'll pass on giving it a proper review because it's not really even worth it. Remember the generic beer back in the 80's and the beer can was white and just said beer? Well they gave it a name and it's called Natural Light. Natural Light would be a better name in the craft beer business but oh well it got slapped on the world's shittiest beer and is forever ruined

When it is 85 degrees outside and you are at a BBQ, drinking hazy, juicy 8% DIPAS that are all the rage right now is not prudent. On days like this, I harken back to my northern NE roots and reach for a Natty. There is nothing pretentious about this beer.

Anheuser-Busch "Natural Light"
12 fl. oz. can coded "18NOV21NB0141"
$2 @ ShopRite #519, Phila., PA

Notes via stream of consciousness: Well it's definitely light in color. It's a crystal clear straw gold beneath a short cap of white foam that's dropping before my eyes. I made sure that I have a "beer clean" glass so it's not that. The aroma is sweetish, and although you can tell that there's some grain there it's not much. It's brewed with "cereal grains" but I don't know what they are, probably rice. I also think I'm getting more fruitiness here than hops which is weird. On to the taste... it tastes like it smells. It's sweetish, very mildly grainy, a touch fruity, and with minimal hop notes. It doesn't really taste like beer to me and I wonder why people who consider themselves beer drinkers drink this. It's like sugar water to be honest. It's 4.2% ABV with just 95 calories and 3..2 grams of carb per can which is pretty good, so at least there's that. It's light bodied and gently crisp then smooth across the tongue. In the end you can tell that it's fairly well made but it's definitely not the best light beer out there, at least if you want something that taste more like beer than it does a malternative.
Review #8,068

Well it’s been a few years since we graduated college and none of us have really thought about this beer in years. Yet here we are with a Natty Light in our possession. No one has ever considered this good. We all know this is the beer you buy when you need volume on a budget. Has the taste changed since we last consumed this carbonated water that has been filter through some old pennies? Absolutely not. Light, easy to drink and instantly fills you with regret. Thoughts of “I have a job, why am I drinking this?” Enter your head as you take down this metallic can of piss water.

12 ounce can poured into a tumbler style pint glass.

L: Crystal clear, pale straw, one plus inch of stark white foam last about a minute before receding to a ring.
S: Opens nice with large grain aroma then settles to floral hops and lesser grain aroma, nose mostly disappears with the head, there is an occasional off wet dog-like aroma.
T: Very little flavor, light toasted "grainy" malt and floral hops, aftertaste is a bit harsh.
F: Highly carbonated, opens with a crisp bite, astringent mouth coating quality, thin bodied.
O: Below average for style in my opinion.

There's a time and place for cheap beer in my house. There is never a time and place for Natty. Had some at a friends house just to have something fizzy to drink and it's just rancid stuff. Give me a Bud Light, a Coors, Miller, Corona, Yuengling Light, or anything over this junk any day. It's not that it's without flavor, but that the flavor is putrid.

This beer is plain and simple. Crack it open, drink, repeat. Superior drinkability and decent flavor for the best price you can find anywhere! Not sure why guys with gigantic beer guts who chug triple hopped session hazy nitro cold fermented IPA’s rate this beer because you know what you’re gettin at $18 a 30 rack!

I actually like this beer. It goes down easy and has a nice clean taste about it. Usually anything from AB I really don't like but Nat is good stuff. When finished mowing the yard this will be my take a rest beer.

(4.25) Smell: Citrus, mild pine, loads of grapefruit
4.25 taste: grapefruit, pine, a mild yeast character (or malt?, seems more yeast), Citra hop
4.75 feel: a nice bitterness back of palate encompassed by a soft pillowy mf

Ovr 4.5

majority of craft brew losers will upvote a disgusting adjunct stout or ipa, but shit all over easily drinkable and affordable, quality beer. ready for the kids to move on to some other nonsense and let the craft beer fad die out. its about time. this lager is extremely drinkable and cheap. if u prefer a 18 dollar 4 pack of lactose infused ipa shit, go blow it out your ass and die. ukraine needs blood for the cashcows, sign urself up losers.

Look, I'm not gonna get on here and say that Natty Light is the best beer in the world. I don't drink Natty Light because it tastes great. But it does its job, and it does it pretty damn well. It's the go-to cheap beer that I can crush on a hot day when I'm hanging out with some pals.

Tastes like nostalgia.

C'mon, we all know what this beer is so why would anyone discuss the "body, aroma, mouthfeel, nuances ....." It's Natural Light and I'm sure we've ALL had it.

Look, It's not going to rank up there with IPA's or German Maibachs and it's not supposed too.
THIS type of beer just like Miller Light, Bud Light, Michelob light etc. is the kind of cheap beer you grab on a hot day after mowing the grass. It's has low abv, they're light, crisp and go down quick and easy. It's a basic thirst quenching beer and there's nothing wrong with keeping a few of these in your garage fridge for those "I need a quick beer before I start weedwacking" moments. If it embarrasses you, put it in a coozie.

16 oz. Can poured into Imperial pint glass
Look: light straw, lots of bubbles, three finger head quickly dissipates to thin foam, some lacing
Smell: Some maltiness, more sweet though
Taste: Pretty straight forward lager style, a little watered down, a little bitter on the finish
Mouthfeel: Some carbonation, light mouthfeel
Overall: Pretty average. If you want something that is cold, tastes like beer, can find at nearly any gas station and not break the bank, give it a shot.
Not the best light beer I've had, bit not the worst.
Dont worry about food pairings with this one. It is too simple to overthink.

25oz can from Grocery Outlet. Pale, clear golden, fizzy, foamy head. Head looked promising, then...poof...gone. Grainy aroma, adjunct grains, corn. Taste is sweet, grainy flavors with a slight vegetal character. Hops provide a quick sting then it all fades into nothingness, which is good because I certainly wouldn't want that flavor to linger.

From Notes:
Looks like Miller. Smells like Miller. Tastes like Miller with water chaser. Then another water to wash it down. Feels too light to count as beer. Overall, I don't know. This isn't my thing.

I didn't think I would have anything good to say about O'douls, but it's a damn site better than this. Even for a low alcohol brew, this is just not good. I really do not like the taste, and can't get past that

Bottle ran me $0.99.

Medium-bodied but lacking in flavour. Amber malt, 6 row/pale malt, malt extract.

Certainly drinkable. It has a nice albeit shallow flavour. A dependable nonalcoholic beer, but not something anyone would likely crave. Probably better than Odoul's, but do we really care?

High C / AVERAGE

12 oz. can:

Pours clear pale straw yellow with a decent white head and lacing for the style.

The smell is of... well, what little smell there is is of... not much. Maybe some grain or adjunct (corn?). Clean.

The taste is of... not much. There is something that hints towards grain. An odd chemical-ish something in the very brief finish.

Watery and not terribly fizzy. Crisp as tonic water.

There are much better NA brews out there. This has virtually nothing to it except water and some bubbles.

I had this on a clean palate and I am not congested. This is too mild, even for a macro NA adjunct lager.

Look: murky yellow with a lot of carbonation.
Feel: fizzy, malty, and light.
Taste: sweet and malty, a bit like pear cider. Tastes like flat beer.
Smell: Apple juice and malted corn.

Pours a yellow color with a lot of carbonation and a nice head. The smell is of grains mostly corn and the taste is the same. Mouthful is watery but ok overall it is ok to drink, just a bit to watered down for me.
Good beer taste for non alcohol beer of course I'm not real picky on taste as much as I am price. Paid about $10 and some change for a 12 pack of cans. It gets the job done.

Here comes that weak ass straw yellow you've seen bandied about in several incarnations from Miller Brewing. On top of that, you see something that can't retain a head whatsoever. Aroma was of heat pressed canned vegetables and only the slightest amount of 6 row barley.

Taste gave up the water more than anything. Hops and yeast were barely perceptible. Best part of this non alcoholic beer is that its bitterness and almost heat like mouthfeel made you think not only was it harsh, but that it drank hot! Yeah, gotta say, O'Doul's smokes this.

Poured from 12 oz can into a pilsner glass (my poor pilsner glass).
Right out of the gate, it's golden but carbonated and lacking a head at all.
Smelled of malt and maybe veggies of some sort.
Tasted like barely and carrots were dipped into a glass of water. No thank you.
Mouthful was thin as water.
Overall, the worst NA I've had, and I've had quite a few.
When you think this style couldn't be worse than O'Douls, you try one of these when your wife hands it to you. Honestly, these shouldn't be considered beer.

A-Pours a straw color with a slight head and lacing
A-Aroma has slight malt hints
T-The taste follows the nose with a slight malt flavor
M-A light bodied well carbonated beer
O-A decent beer

this is some fabulously bad stuff.

it hardly tastes like beer. it tastes as though someone put sweet yeast rolls into a blender with a few cups of water and pulverized the stuff into drinkable form.

of the three US domestic NA brews I've tried, this is the only one that offended my palate enough that I won't give it a second try.

Appearance : Pours a pale pale straw yellow color, bordering on clear. The head is 1 finger tall and actually stays around unlike the Coors N/A I tried last night. Lace is left on the sides of the glass.

Aroma : Mashed carrots, yam, peas, potato. A faint bit of plastic. Mostly just vegetal smells. Bleh.

Flavor : A faint bit of mashed veggies which disappears rather quickly and develops into more of a roasted fire corn flavor. Faint club soda and brown potato skin finish off the taste.

Mouthfeel : A bit more present than the Coors N/A that I had last night. Very carbonated, on the heavy side of light bodied, ends sparkling like club soda.

Overall : Not absolutely horrid, I could possibly get used to this for how cheap it is while I heal from my yeast overgrowth. Soon I'll be doing actual beer reviews again, but for now it's time to explore the world of near-beers.

You cannot beat a Keystone. I’m telling you if your looking to be complex this is not for you but for those who are looking for a beer to drink all day long at the beach and not gain 30 pounds this is it. It gets a bad rap for being “cheap horse piss” but seriously the flavor is better than most cheap light beers (the exception being Miller Lite which is probably equal), it drinks well and you can’t beat the price. And who doesn’t love the marketing genius that invented Keith Stone? I love good beer, I love craft beer and trying new things but when it’s hot and I know I’m going to down a pack or two I’ll always grab a stone.

Poured from an undated 12oz can

On the pour a cloudy completely white head forms which recedes to 1cm relatively quickly then slows down and receded to a decent cap over a few minutes, it never goes headless. Carbonation is strong on a golden straw body. It tries to lace but the ring becomes saggy.

Aroma is essentially all cheap lager off flavor. Likely mistreated yeast, but it comes off as a bit tart. Behind that is a hint of malt and corn. Very light and no real hops to be picked up on.

Flavor is similar to the aroma however loses a lot but not all of the tartness. Behind that is a slight bitterness and a sweet corny maltiness. Overtime converts to a dry finish. Not the worst but pretty boring. It's light as it promised.

Feel is decent for the pricepoint. Smooth and almost creamy from the head with a decently long finish, and once you get over the smell a pretty good crispness. Once again very light.

Overall a decent but flawed cheap ass beer. Pretty close to piss water with a hint of grain. For a light beer I'd say it's pretty good. It's been a long time since I've had coors light, and honestly I'd say this has more flavor.

I try not to be snobby when it comes to beer. Or rather, I try to meet beer on its own terms. Craft beers are trying for depth, complexity, and deliciousness. They hold themselves to an elevated standard - they're meant to be a great experience, not just a beverage.

Macro beer is different. Much like fast food is to fine dining, macro beer is designed to be cheap, plain, and inoffensive. Most macros, including this one, are just that. White bread and mineral flavors, no real head or hops profile, highly carbonated and refreshing cold. There are, of course, bad beers in the cheap category. Ones that fail to be boring, and are instead gross (Steel Reserve, for instance.) This brew, Keystone Light, serves its purpose; to be a casual beverage, much like tea or soda. A lot less sugar, so it's probably better for you than soda, actually, unless you're killing a case.

When I come home from a long day of work, and I don't feel like writing tasting notes or looking through the china cabinet for the right glass, I'll happily knock back a few cans of this, or maybe some Miller Lite, for a decent buzz and a deeper sleep. All things have a place in this universe, after all.

What can I say, it’s watery, tastes like beer-flavored mineral water. Goes down real easy, especially on a hot summer day in Texas.
Would recommend as a quick refresher.
Taste is water with some minerals, a hint of corn, and not much else. Almost like watered down Coors light. Go figure haha.

Used to drink this beer in college only because a keg could be purchased at certain gas stations for $49.99……yeah. It made for a cost effective beer for Beer Pong.

Goes down like water, has that metallic like taste of Coors Light (Keystone is brewed by Coors). Sweet smelling, light golden in color. Always left me with a terrible headache in the morning.
Overall, its bottom of the barrel Coors Light.

I cant imagine why anyone would still be drinking this beer if they are out of High School or college.

12oz can (dated June 8 2019, I think) poured into 16oz tulip. The appearance was the expected very pale straw yellow of the style, with about 1/3 inch of white head that had very low retention and no lacing.

The aroma was also as expected: sorta sweet, very soft grains, almost no noticeable hops.

Same on the tongue, just a bland, basic beeriness.

The body was the expected thin and watery that typifies the style, with a semi-sweet finish.

Drinkability was, again, as expected; fine as a quick lawnmower beer, and not much else.

Overall, we all know what this is. Nor surprises. for tickers only.

KeyStone Light is made by Coors Brewing Company.

The packaging is pretty unique and vibrant. It's not expensive at all for a 15 pack but I highly recommend not getting the ice version as it'll give you a nasty hangover.

The alcohol is standard but the flavor is pretty good. It's very light, almost like water with a beer aftertaste. It doesn't really smell at all. It has a light scent but nothing that'll stink up the place.

Overall, I do recommend this beer for the price and insignificant taste and smell. They're easy to drink and good for the price.
Best beer money can buy. Absolutely cannot change my mind. Every time I crack a can I feel like I'm sitting on the summit of the tallest mountain in the Rockies.

I have drank Keystone Light for years as my regular go to and it is average. The key factor over the many years is simply the volume I consume vs the price. the stuff is at least around here gets down to 10 bucks for a 30 pack compare that to many of the other domestic budget beers range from 13-17 for a 30 pack. If you are only drinking 1 can ever and not drinking an excessive amount on a daily basis I understand the current overall score of 45 but I got to say there is not much better of a beer for bonfires and drunk out door parties when your footin the bill on the tab.
just a good all bargain american ice lager. Very smooth and delicate flavor. The snobs will hate it but its a great value and delicious on a hot summer day.
What sort of unfortunate turns of events led me to drink this? I … just don’t. Even if that’s all there is available. Although it’s nickname is “Natty Ice,” this was just plain nasty.
Came in hyped then let down. I guess PBR is the best unknown secret. It's hard to compare the full body of PBR to the competition. Drink PBR bro, aka Pabst Blue Ribbon.

Definitely not as bad as I was expecting, but not nearly as good as Icehouse for direct comparison. Some okay malt sweet bready notes in the flavor. The aftertaste was a bit bothersome - metallic and dry. Otherwise drinkable.

Pours and looks like an American style lager, but the head fades quickly. Nose is insanely sweet. Tastes like bitter sugar, maybe a Gummi that has turned bad. Overall, I would not recommend this to anyone I like. It'll do, I guess, if your senses of taste and smell have gone dormant and you want a cold high alcohol beverage.

Natty ice!! Yes even anheuser busch on there website now refers to natural ice as Natty Ice. It’s a very budget friendly bottom tank beer that when drank ice cold is good. It’s not meant to be in any class of craft brews, but it does stand on par with higher price American Adjunts of higher prices. All in all for a ICE beer if drank cold like mentioned above it’s one of the best ice beers to drink

From a 25oz silo:

Appearance: Clear, yellow gold, good head at first, then fizzles out.

Smell: A little barley, then seltzer and clay.

Taste: Mild sweetness, then some fruitiness like grape or apple that reminds me I'm drinking a mediocre high abv beer. Finishes with some nondescript bitterness.

Overall: Picked up a silo out of curiosity and for a cheap lager to kick off a football Saturday. Was a little better than I expected but not as good as an Icehouse or Mickey's or OE800 for a cheapo beer.

Look - poured from a 12 oz can. Pale yellow in color, with actually a sizable head that has some retention, which mostly dissipates after about a minute.

Smell - corn, syrup, and just a tad bit of funkiness. some alcohol comes through in the smell as well if it's warm enough.

Taste - when drank cold, tastes like just about any other adjunct: light, slightly sweet, and a subtle malty finish. however, if it warms, the beer really does taste nasty. in particular, the booziness really comes through, which is rough and reminiscent of gasoline. just drink it cold.

Feel - light bodied, high carbonation, and boozy for its type at 5.9%

Overall - despite the fact that I wrote a full review, Natty Ice really isn't meant to be analyzed. When it's cold, it drinks like any adjunct lager and gets you where you want to be quicker. however, if you sit around and start trying to pick out the flavors, that's when it starts to get nasty. Bottom line: it does what it's supposed to do.
For Ice beers this is my favorite. If we think of the context of what Natural Ice is which is a get drunk quick scheme beer is the best of all ice beers., It is CHEAP and will get the party starting.

Pours 10k gold with a generous but quickly dissipating head. Lightly carbonated, but then again I have this chilled in the mid 30's. Pale malt and a touch of corn dominate the nose. Though not visibly carbonated, there is a fine bubbly fizzation on the tongue, much akin to champs. Mightily crisp, clean, refreshing and quite satisfying, this quencher was far more enjoyable than anticipated. At 2 bucks for the 25 oz or about 6 bucks a six-pack, it's a bit overvalued, but nonetheless enjoyed it on a curiosity powered goof..
This beer is phenomenal. I love the smooth sessionable mild lager taste and the price is unbeatable. You just can’t go wrong with Natural Ice in my book!

This beer is fine.
The taste isn't really great if you stop and think about it, but this beer is not the kind of beer that's made to be analyzed. This beer is like an average main stream comedy movie. It's rude and too much, but it's just there to be enjoyed.
This is blue collar construction worker beer after you get home or when you legitimately want to get a nice buzz on after a hard work week.

The first of the month is here, and you know what that means. I’m sitting on my apartment porch in a lawn chair enjoying the best St. Louis has to offer. I’ve decided to go with the 25 oz format this time as I feel like I deserve it after my walk back from the cumberland farms I bought it from. The first pour into the glass displays a beautiful golden color. The kind of golden hue that my grandmother’s teeth have. The head quickly disipates once the liquid gold is settled. The smell has quite an inviting metallic must to it. Even though the scent of the evolving alcoholic fills the room, the flavor was a bit underwhelming. Essentially all bark, not bite with the taste. There are hints of spoiled apple and aluminum that compliment the stogie I’m ripping on. The feel of this gem is very light and dry like my work ethic. Overall, I rate this a solid 2.5. I can’t wait for next month, so I can treat myself again.

Pours piss yellow with a 1/2 inch white head; lots of bubbles. Not very much to the smell, just a little malt & straw. The taste is actually pretty good, it's not complex so I'm not about to try & break it down. But, it is full bodied & quite nice. The feel is light & pretty high in carbonation, very easy to session to say at the least. This beer is highly underrated for what it is, very affordable & I will definitely be drinking more of these in the future.

Poured from the can into a standard pint.

A: Light fizzy and effervescent as expected. Pale straw color. Solid tight white head.

S: Faint grain. Typical cheap pukey hop smell from AALL type. Aluminum can notes remain.

T: Shockingly not as bad as nose. Watery and grainy as expected. I do not hate this ice cold on a hot day like today was.

M: Carbonation makes it so light that you hardly notice the underlying chalkiness, but it is there I assure you. Odd dryness with that bitter pill taste at ultimate finish when it warms up...did I mention to keep it really cold?

O: You might call this walrus piss. It is not intended to impress fancy beer palates. It is for long session days when you do not want to get arrested in a black-out drunken rage at the most redneck campground. You know, where you overhear comments like the jailbird neighbors threatening physical violence to their tattooed floozey for not getting them another beer fast enough. It saves you from that embarassment.

12oz bottle, stolen from my uncle's fridge

This is so light it's barely beer. Very light scent and taste, badly burned corn and maybe an ethereal kiss of hops, like you can tell they're there but you're not actually smelling or tasting them. This is a bust, but on a low-carb diet there aren't many options

Bad even considering what it is...
Great Beer! To watch calories and carbs, this is the best tasting beer yet. I would/will drink even when not watching weight. Love the taste. It loses nothing in flavor. Very crisp.

7/11/2021 9:10pm EST
Fort Myers Beach, FL

Poured into a pint glass

Look: Straw yellow (SRM 1) with a bright white and sparkling ocean foam head. Lacing and head retention are pleasant.

Smell: A faint hint of isolated oat and apple.

Taste: A shadow of traditional Miller. The nutty-like characteristic is present, but very diluted.

Feel: Very light and watery with a delicate fiz.

Overall: One could think about drinking a beer and it would be more like drinking a beer than drinking this beer. When the calories were cut, so were the taste and ABV. This is the opposite of a too high and intrusive ABV beer.

Ever since Miller Brewery came out with this lower alcohol beer, I have been excited to be able to have the great taste of beer without all of the negative effects that I had been experiencing with the Miller Lite beer...
I also don't have to take medication for heartburn etc. I am having a hard time understanding why I am having trouble getting the Miller 64 beer! Please don't stop distributing Miller 64 here in Pasco County Florida, The Tampa Bay Area.

This is my favorite beer but it is not available
At any of the many liquor stores in the Trenton/Hamilton areas. Alot of my friends drink this beer also and our private club cant even order.
What is going on with the Miller company.

My fave!!! So sad I can barely find it now.... only bottles that are more expensive and in 12 packs... this beer is my jam! I can’t wait to have an ice cold can of it again!! Nice and refreshing, also great for someone that tends to drink fast! I chug everything I drink so this helps me keep my mind focused and still get to enjoy the fun! :)

I don't understand why this beer is so hated on this site. It is just about the only decent low-alcohol beer available in the US. I like to be able to have a few beers at social events and remain unimpaired. Miller 64 is great for that.

You ever get the feeling you're having a product for the last time, not because you aren't into it, but because its days are numbered on the production line? MillerSeltzer about to gentrify this neighborhood of beer. If Tomorrow Never Comes, will this beer know how much I meh her?

Just look at the dang color of this beer through its clear bottle. Dude, Who Spilled Light Beer in My Water? They go hard on the carbonation as this fizzes upward with the pour, but retention is like Raineer Wolfcastle doing comedy. That's the joke. The aroma lacks 3/4 of the beer components, and the one it has, water, well, its not supposed to be aromatic. And that's about the best where this beer is concerned: where it does almost nothing.

Taste is an afterthought, this is just meant to be something wet to consume after you run a 100 mile marathon or something. Or maybe you make an ass of yourself when you drink and you need these to keep yourself in check. The thing is, notions of malt, hops and yeast are completely lost on this beer. This makes Miller Lite and especially High Life seem like imperial stouts in comparison. Upside: not really anything in the way of an off flavor, just lacking flavor for the most part, mouth feel isn't heavy.

From a 12oz can:

Appearance: Clear light gold, small head.

Smell: Corn.

Taste: Light sweetness, corn, seltzer-like dryness, watery.

Overall: Some friends had this in their beer fridge, so I had one for a review. Not bad for what it is--a very light beer. It basically tastes like watered down Miller Lite.

(12 oz clear bottle, NOV0419; purchased cold single... poured into Stella Artois glass)

L: polished-clear, pale gold liquid; initially curiously lasting, glistening sponge of off-white foam - did leave a long, broad, crystalline band of lace at the top

S: urinal cake, delicate spicy-floral overtone; grain aroma like rye flour... like a High Life, stripped of its substance; not meant to be smelled?

T: grassy-bitter bite atop (again) a floury grain flavor, very subtle flash of cereal grain in the finish, but very little malt definition altogether; nearly bone dry... moderate peppery phenolic spice is all that's left humming on the palate

F: no definition to its thin body; mildly sharp and spritzy; remarkably dry with just that soft spicy warmth lingering

O: could be the glass altering the presentation of its aromas?... regardless, execution-wise a wonderfully dry, but more parching than refreshing drink; flavor-wise virtually flavorless - comes with the territory for a low-abv, low-calorie beer... one should really just abstain if this is what one's reduced to (1551)

A step above Red Dog, which once again is not saying too much. At least you will be cutting calories with this beer. It is a solid go to over Michelob, if that is what is available. Once again Miller over Budweiser seems to be better at times like those.

Not much flavor or smell, but it will make an excellent golfing beer. Just the right amount of light and low alcohol to not throw off your perfect(bogie for me) game, but still be drinking a real beer instead of soda or just water. I dig it. Not gonna be a staple for my fridge, but for my outdoor style it fits.

I am a sippy cup drinker. I put the cap on the bottle, and left this beer out over night. 11 hours later = still bubbling and no less refreshing.

+All beers should taste good or be enjoyable at room temperature.

Most beers are sensitive like soft red apples that brown and rot before done enjoying them, if you leave the slices of apple without the Corona lime added, many beers = #budlight garbage cans.

The lightest I’ve had that I can remember. It is reminiscent of Miller Lite, but with that subtle savory soapy flavor to make it special. A beer that’ll have you more sober than you were when you started. A beer with so much water you’ll swear it’s a thirst quencher. I have three more and I’m looking forward to them. 2018/04/20

Dude this is a light beer and the cheapest one, do since all light beer tastes the same this should be the most popular one. It was about 12-13 years ago (because that's when the 08 recession hit and I closed shortly after) I sold it for $1 a can. We started calling it millionaire beer cause everyone pretended they were rich buying rounds for everyone.

Have only thrown up once due to alcohol in my life, and this beer was the culprit. Stinks of urine, tastes like urine stirred with sweaty gym socks, and leaves the heaviest, nastiest hangover you will ever suffer from. Avoid this beer at all costs. The worst excuse for an alcoholic beverage I have ever had the misfortune to imbibe.

I usually would never give ANY beer this low a score but it is the beer I will always remember, not for good reason. I was in college and consistently drank terrible beer, weekly. The usually adjunct lagers and even worse. This beer was unpalatable for me, even when I drank BMC beers on the reg and thought they were good. A couple friends and I pick it up for a game of beer pong in college and left it sitting in the corner of the garage. It was awful. Try it just to say you've had the worst beer ever made.

I busted a party with some kids and they were drinking this stuff. Smelled like old garbage and farts. One kid said they paid $8 for a 30 pack. That's cheaper than Natty Light. They were underage so I had them pour it out.

Came back to that same house a week later for another underage party and the grass was dead in the spot they poured out last weeks batch. I'd avoid this swill

Notes on this brew:
Brewed with dirty gym socks, and pigfeed corn.
May be paired with industrial cleaner to strengthen its effect
A bold drink for the new generation of "trailer trash" and college kids with no money
May be mistook for grape soda due to the ridiculous purple can. That's how they trick you into accidentally drinking it.

Look, I don't know what everyone is bashing...this shit costs like $10 for a 30 pack what do you expect? Golden ambrosia served in a chalice while angels whistle on your dong?
For less than $.50 a can, I don't think this is a bad beer at all; perfect for games and casual drinking (and I'd take it over bud light any day of the week). Is this a connoisseur's beer? Hell no! It's made to get a person buzzed and save a few bucks. The taste and carbonation remind me of Miller Lite or Coors light..leaning more towards Coors. There is a slight aftertaste which I don't experience in the pricier pisswater ranges...but honestly; I stopped noticing after the second can. Smells and looks like cheap beer to me! Mouthfeel is right up there with any other light beer. Taste is like I said, somewhere between Miller and Coors slightly sweeter and with a short, dirty aftertaste. Of course it's not top-notch, but look at that price tag! Red Dog isn't even this cheap most of the time and that's one of two beers (along with side pocket) that are undrinkable to me. It's not as sweet nor as nasty and off-putting as some of the ones that there are for the same amount of money in my area (Boxer, Lost Lake, Red Dog, Side Pocket, any HG product, Icehouse, etc). Support a Wisconsin brewery and save a few bucks while your at it for your next drinking game or beer bong-off.
For the record: Fav beers are: Alaskan Amber and Wisconsin Brewery's Porter Joe.

Looks like a beer, smells like a beer, taste like a beer, feels like a beer, and overall I'd say it's a pretty darn good beer for after mowing the yard on a hot day like I just did. And the price is pretty darn good for a six-pack of 16oz.
Don't need no "fu-fu' beer just a real cold REAL BEER. Bottoms up!!

Look of golden straw.
smell very fine stale open can from the night before smell.
tastes faintly stale. Not undrinkable just somewhat off.
Feels great. It is not overly carbonated feels light.
In Iowa and Illinois is 12-13 a 30 pack. Extremely cheap. It is a great party supply beer. In the same vein Keystone light is the same if not a little cheaper beer that is a far superior beer (all things considered). I can see why some people get used to it cause the cost and beer flavor but I cannot get past the stale after taste.
All I can say is smooooth. If you want a beer you don’t wanna think about and sip on a hot day after working outside: here you go. Overall it’s a solid light beer you can have more than a few of.
This light beer for the money pretty good easy to drink taste like Miller lite and very easy on the wallet only other beer I rate close to this is genny light hands down better than Natural light

Just like with the original, I am not a fan of this one. I do like mb ice, but not this. A little too sweet, goes go down easy though. Sweetness aside, there is not much in the way of memorable flavor

12 oz aluminum can into a plastic 16 oz cup. Very faint aroma but surprisingly decent head of foam. Staw/golden in appearance w/streaming bubbles. Highly carbonated. 15 cans bought for $6.99 at a local supermarket. Slight sweetness with just a hint of malted grains at the back of the throat. Clean and crisp. Goes down easily. Low abw makes it perfect for a drinking session. Refreshing and low calorie. Might not be everyone's choice though given the bias against so called macro brews. I think it deserves a solid B.

Bought a 15-pack cans $9.49 Don Quijote
Light malt smell
Clear light golden color
Light mouthfeel
Medium carbonation
Slightly sweet light malt flavor
Overall what you would expect from a cheap light beer. Not much taste, but you could easily drink a lot of them.

AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am sure some people like this beer, I love Hamm's so I cannot be too pessimistic about this one. It is still an awful tasting brew. It tastes like someone filtered garbage that was cooked and strained through used plant matter. Smells and tastes like yeast farts!

I was attracted to this one because of the price, and the alcohol volume/calorie count ratio. This is about two dollars more per case than Genny Light (the cheapest light beer in my area), and has a higher alcohol content and fewer calories (more akin to its pricier cousin, Miller Lite.)

Look: Just decent. Lighter in color than Miller Lite, with a similar foamy head that diminishes quickly but clings to my pilsner glass. Better than Busch, Keystone, or almost any other budget light lager.

Smell: Nothing. Seriously, this smells like water that was poured out of a glass that once contained beer. Not winning any awards here.

Taste: Grainy, in a cheap AAL way, but not at all offensive. No cooked veggie taste, decent malt backbone for a light. Absolutely zero hop flavor, making it less complex than Miller Lite. Pretty good, much better than Keystone or any other competing bottom-shelf light.

Feel: Where this beer shines! Almost champagne-like in a Miller High Life kinda way. Excellent carbonation retention all the way through, contributing to that clingy head. No slick oily finish, as you get with Busch or Keystone.

Overall: Almost too easy to drink, and at this price point it's tough to resist. There are few better alternatives.

L - Pours a straw yellow color with good head retention and lacing. Not as pale as other macro light beers.

S - Sweet malts and corn with a little hops. Predictably less strong scented than Beast Ice, but similar profile.

T - Tastes just like the smell. Corn and malts, tastes like crackers. Hops is little more than a pleasant aftertaste. Watery like any light beer, but very grainy and refreshing.

Overall - I have had very few light beers, but this is a personal favorite in the category. Very refreshing and inoffensive taste. A great beer for parties or relaxing at home. Better than the "premium" light beers, especially Bud Light.

I grew up, my Dad would drink Milwaukee's Best light. Now being 26, I thought I would give it a try. I don't drink light beer regularly, so I can only imagine what others have to say about it ie: bud and keystone drinkers. To start off, this is a good overly rounded beer. There is not too much complexity going on in this beer. Smells yeasty like pizza dough which is something I like in a beer. The beer has no top notes to speak of. Just goes in the mouth vaguely crisp and you get crackers, light toasted bread. Very dry all the way through. No hopp notes or none I can tell. Very easy to drink. This is a nice beer,but I would spend extra to get miller high life instead.

24 ounce can into lager glass, best before 7/16/2018. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread, light biscuit dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. A bit too fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Okay aromas with pale malt/corn and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread, light biscuit dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread, light biscuit dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Solid robustness of pale malt/corn and light earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Nicely clean on lager flavors, not overly fruity. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light body; with a very smooth, fairly bready/grainy, and lightly sticky hop mouthfeel that is good. Pretty thin, but not watery finish. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.1%. Overall this is a decent light adjunct lager style. Solidly flavorful for the ABV. Nice clean malt/grains and decent earthy hop balance. Was a bit too heavy on the fruity corn notes, but definitely enjoyable for the style. Identical to regular MB with a lighter body, and without sacrificing much if any flavor.

This stuff is not that bad. No offensive smells or tastes. Just a simple, light American Adjunct Lager. My grandaddy and uncle both drank this stuff, so maybe there's some nostalgia there for me, but it is honestly worth a buy when placed up against other light beer.

16 oz draft pour at a Twins game. Looks like a light lager. Smells vaguely of hops and malt. The flavor isn't terrible, but it is very watery. It was free. I drank less than half of it. No interest in revisiting this half-beer in the future.

Poured from a 25oz can best by Oct 27th 2022

On the pour a decent 3 finger foamy white fine head formed that dissipates at a medium rate to a decent cap and ring. Carbonation is fine and the body is a golden light straw. Some lacing, decent.

Aroma has some Metallic smell alongside a very light lager yeast that isn't the most crisp, but I was expecting worse. Slight tartness, but a decent but super light crackery malt. Quite light but better than expected.

Taste follows the aroma with some vague off notes but nothing terrible. No hop bitterness and a light crackery barley. Quite watery tasting.

Feel is light and carbonated. Pretty nice, amd the finish isn't instant either. Super drinkable, and not as close to seltzer as michelob ultra.

Overall this is a decent light beer. Better than coors light, keystone, natty, and michelob ultra. About on par with miller lite however. It's a light beer its close to water but not the closest.

how i have been waiting for this day. in ireland, bud light is a relatively new addition to the market, and where it is sold it’s usually sold in 4 packs. now im hardly buying 4 cans of most beer, let alone this, but sure enough today in my local shop there were loose cans, i didn’t really know what to expect from this to be honest, and to be honest it really isn’t as bad as i was expecting, there’s nothing particularly astringent about it, that being said it is some pretty cruddy lager, it’s just a vacuum of flavour, white bread malt and a faint sweetness, no bitterness, medium to high carbonation, reasonably drinkable but incredibly thin and watery, yeah it’s not good, but it’s not the worst either

The first time I had a Bud Light, I wanted a Bud Light Lime. You can do worse in terms of beer, I know folks who treat this drink with anathema. The fact of the matter is that you can consume a Bud Light and drive sober by the time you've finished a savory Mexican dish.

Pours light golden with sparkling water like tiny carbonization fizz in lieu of frothy head. No complex taste, aroma or flavor to note. Not complaining since we are chilling and vibing at the Simi Valley Happy face Music festival with this “free” bottomless light lager “beer” include with admission. Better than water? Cheers!
Bud Light, the best-selling beer in the U.S. for some reason... It tastes awful. It's like a Miller Lite gone wrong. Just get literally anything other than this please.

No more should be needed than one brown twelve ounce bottle poured into a clear pint glass. There's no head, no glass lacing, almost no aroma and it's one of the most transparent amber colors you'll ever see. There are vague taste references to yeast, malt, hops and alcohol, without any discernable hierarchy. There is some decent carbonation and it's blandly drinkable. Still, it's not worth the time, calories or expense, unless it's free. In that case, reread the other two reasons not to drink it.

I decided to pick up a can at the LCBO in Ontario 473ml at 4% in Canada brewed by Labbats brewery.
anyways this bud light poured into glass with 1 finger head clear golden color good carbonation.. smooth easy drinking beer and very refreshing.
Didn't leave much of a lace but it tasted good . Labbats brewery did ok
I can buy this again

Very enjoyable.
Good for those days when I want to drink 3 or more beers without "paying the price" the next day.
Budweiser has obviously researched the "LIKEABILITY" of this beer before committing to mass production.
If you don't like Light Lagers.....then please have some respect and common decency, stop looking for a CHEAP TICK and DON'T REVIEW THEM.

It's not the greatest beer in the world for sure, but if you just finished mowing the yard, it hits the spot or if you're short on the green then it's the perfest brew. At $5.50 a six-pack 16 ounces I'll take this over the hi-faluten'-over-priced craft beer every day.

It’s definitely not awful. It’s not great or mind blowing but it’s a decent tasting lager that’s also really cheap.
It’s very light straw, clear, decent white head with surprisingly good retention.
Smell is sweet malt and mineral water, a hint of sulfur.
Tastes semisweet with a tart finish, not exactly sour but tart. There’s a slightly sour aftertaste that I actually enjoyed. This sample is from a 16 oz can.
I can’t say this would be my go-to beer but at $5.79 for a sixer of pints it’s for sure a good value for those on a budget. (I’ve been there before).
The finish is crisp and semi dry.
It also makes good michelada’s if you’re into those. There’s absolutely nothing better after you’ve been out working in some really hot weather. (Start with 1 part Clamato and 2 parts beer. Add Tabasco, lime, tajin, even some orange juice. It doesn’t have to be precise. Enjoy

Anheuser-Busch "Busch Ice"
25 fl. oz. can coded "22102 WA1009". Sampled on 7 May 2022
$1.79 @ Carool's Discount Liquor, Merchantville, NJ

Notes via stream of consciousness: It's a good thing I bought "THE BIG ONE" seeing as how this is rated "Awful" on beeradvocate. Ehh, it was only $1.79 and I got to get 'the eye' for going into a store in Camden, NJ that I damned well knew I shouldn't be in. (I know, I know, it's technically Merchantville - I can't figure out how that's possible - but it's a block away from what's technically Camden). What can I say, I like the weirdo beers and malt liquors! It's poured a clear straw gold body beneath a finger's width of white foam. The head seems to be holding pretty well so it seems pretty good so far. The aroma is limited to a generic but clearly adjunct-enhanced beer. There are no real hops, just a smear in the background. On the upside it's clean, but this isn't a malt liquor, it's just 5.9% ABV so I wouldn't expect anything weird. On to the taste... it follows the aroma which is a good thing in that it's clean, but bad in that it's fairly boring; t here is a little bit of an apple-like fruitiness to it though. It's lightly sweetish and thus nicely balanced by a moderate bitterness and generic background hoppiness. The alcohol never shows but then again at 5.9% it shouldn't, although it is possible, I assure you. It finishes mainly dry with a very short lingering finish. It's basically the same beer from start to finish except that you get a little more malt upfront and the apple doesn't step in until mid-palate. I've had worse European light lagers that have had more character to them but weren't nearly as well made, and then there's the beers from the Baltic region and Russia that honestly seem like they've been brewed with anti-freeze. Of course in parts of Russia that could be a selling point - 'Whatever Beer - Keeps You From Freezing!". So we're basically done here. In the mouth it's medium on the lighter side, and gently crisp-then-smooth.

This one pours a watery looking golden yellow color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like sweet corn and grassiness, and not much else.

This is certainly NOT good, but it's honestly not as a bad as I thought it could be. It's not as skunky as it could be, with just very little flavor to it overall - a mild sweetness and a decent crispness on the back end is about all I get.

This is light bodied, mostly clean, and very watery.

I expected this to be dumpster juice, but it's basically slightly sweet water that tastes like it's been left out for a while.

12oz can - review from notes

This is like regular busch lite, but with a shot of rotgut poured in. And you aren't getting much more ABV for how much worse this tastes

Rusty headache water

I bought a can from the beerstore in Ontario 473ml at 5.5%.
my can was brewed by labatt brewing company in Canada.
it poured a 1finger head into glass that quickly evaporated and left a little lace but the taste was skunky not that enjoyable to me medium bitterness very slow carbonation.
maybe the one brewed in the states is better but this is awful I must say .
cheers.

This is the best Ice beer in its class. All other Ice beers bow to this one. It has the best taste of them as long as it is cold. Of course there are better beers out there but for hot day after mowing the lawn this one is fine.

Consumed at Lake Timberline, Bonne Terre, MO on a rainy October night many moons ago. The appearance of this beer was average. That, however is where the niceties end for this beer. Smell was metallic and boozy. Could definitely tell this was going to be a battle of attrition. The taste was booze with underlying hints of green apples. Not good. The mouthfeel was seltzer-like on the tongue. Overall, I'd avoid this like the plague.

Assaulted by corn/alcohol smell first thing. Not very enjoyable. No hops to speak of. Cloying corn and GMO grains. If you are looking for a cheap buzz, do yourself a favor, avoid bush ice at all costs.

Super Beer World reopened from the ashes of Beer World in PA. Now that 6 packs can be purchased in PA, there have been a ton of retail changes in Pittsburgh. BW was the primary supplier to me during my earliest reviews. Yuengling, Iron City and the beers they produced were purchased from this HUGE case store. Reopening as SBW, with a few special deals and a large 6 pack section, I thought to go old school and buy a cheap case. Busch? It was one of the first beers I consumed. I've only looked back on it to review it early in my BA reviews. So, how bad could Busch ICE be? It was 10.99 for the case.

L: Bubbly like soda. Light head and lace. Light yellow.
S: Champagne? I mean, it is darker, but the smell, there is some sweetness, but it's not close to even cheap beer.
F: Watery. Minimal cream from foam. Alcohol remainder
T: Butterscotch soda with a champagne backbone. That is it.

Overall? This is the cheap beer I drank back in the day, only it's bastardized and made ICE. Busch used to be drinkable and likely is, but Busch ICE beer doesn't resemble Busch. It's just bad. If I don't throw them out, it's going to take time to drink this case. Maybe I'll drink it really cold after mowing the lawn.

25oz can stamped 18247 (approximately 8 months old) poured into a vintage Busch pokal glass at fridge temp 5.9% ABV. The beer pours bright golden tinted, straw yellow with nearly white head. The head fizzles away to an island and thin ring. The aroma is very nuetral. I get a hint of grainy sweetness. The taste is nearly tart, sweet, corny grain with no noticeable bitterness. The mouthfeel is thin bodied, adequately carbonated and undry in the finish. There is a little oily/soapy aftertaste and feel but it's not terrible. Overall, not as bad as I expected. Previous Busch beers were more flawed IMO. Not something to seek out, but it does it's job at $1.74 for 25 ounces.

I've already tried Busch and Busch Light. Figured I might as well go for the trifecta. The $1.49/ tall boy price tag didn't hurt.

Look: The clearest ice beer I've ever seen. Not unlike the other two Busch beers, with perhaps slightly more of a head on the initial pour. Not thrilling.

Smell: Faint wheat, grass, biscuit malts, wet cardboard. Unusual for the style, but not unpleasant.

Taste: Surprisingly decent. Most cheap ice beers have a nasty alcoholic burn to them; this one does not. It reminds me somewhat of Olde English malt liquor. Very smooth, kind of like the lighter Busch variants but with a little kick of banana/clove that does a good job of balancing out the alcohol.

Feel: Similar to Genesee Ice. It's lighter than your typical bottom-shelf ice beer, but still slick and gets worse as it warms up.

Overall: You could do much worse in the style. It's not a great beer by any means, but it's a good buzz for the buck.
Another ice beer that I used to drink 2 decades ago, but no longer cosume. May be the ice beer I like the least, hence the 2.0 rating. I don't know what it was, but it just never grew on me

Pale amber gold with two fingers of white head. Splotches of lace appear as level drops.
Smell is grain bin musky grassy herbal hops.
Taste is grain bin light touch of grassy herbal hops.
Mouthfeel is light to medium with good carbonation. The finish is lightly dry and balanced.
Overall a decent Ice lager.
To me it’s the best ice beer. Very smooth and easy drinking. Refreshing on a hot day after yard work. Just kick back and relax with one or two and you’re set. Cheers.

(25 oz can - THE BIG ONE - code 8290 WA1325 ... poured into a snifter)

L: perfectly crystal-clear, pale gold liquid; white foam on pour self-destructs, leaving med-thin collar, shallow island of bubbles in the middle... actually some spotty lacing; collar keeps till end

S: sweet apple juice, hay, mellow underbelly of cereal grain and masa... a fruity pancake?; soft hint of sweet esters... after sips, only faint, corn syrup/meal note cuts through

T: essence of an apple danish/muffin (apple, light almost doughy malt), just without sugary sweetness... after those first two sips, familiar lightly-pommed Kix cereal grainy flavor takes over... hints at syrupy sweet, but frayed-clipped on the back end, very mild watery finish... has similar vague phenolic banana note in aftertaste as Busch standard

F: lithe, comfortably light-bodied; nearly silky smooth viscosity; latent gas, but no real sizzle; mild perhaps alcohol 'legs' in the finish... just a dream drink from the glass

O: taste kind of straddles adjunct lager and malt liquor... not all that bad for an 'Ice', probably one of the better, more palatable ones I've had; dare say I liked it more and more as it went along... easily could have finished whole can, but will buy again!

Served from 25oz can into shaker glass. Standard lager appearance -- 2" sudsy white head, mild lacing, pale straw color, moderate streaming bubbles. Aroma -mild toasted malt and slight corn sweetness. Mouthfeel is light to medium, frothy with a crisp, dry finish. Flavor of lightly toasted malt, cracker, a bit of corn, with a mild hop bite. Overall: a decent offering in the style.

Pours out a clear medium yellow color. Head is white with almost no retention. No lacing.
Smells a bit like banana. Could be the corn. There is also a faint graininess in the back but not much else.
Pretty light tasting for 5.9 abv. If its really cold that is. The cheap corn sweetness makes its appearance as the it warms.
Mouthfeel is light to medium bodies with high carbonation. Standard for the style.

It isnt too bad when cold. But as warms watch out.

Darker gold than regular Budweiser. Soapy loose head that doesn’t linger.
Smells very neutral.
Tastes like bread, crackers, malted grain, very little in the way of hops. Crisp with a surprisingly nice aftertaste. There’s a little alcohol heat on the backend as well, probably from being brewed with rice or corn syrup.
I think this beer gets a bad rap because it’s cheap, it also makes good micheladas if your into that.

only picked this one up because a fresh batch of 18 oz bottles came in and i figured, hell i hate budweisers line of products even after a fair shake of trying them. so may as well try this one too, since im a fair guy. first one had no carb, had to go get a replacement, short walk. this one, carbonation is fine. heyoooooooo. tastes the same as the previous bottle with no carbonation. but with bubbles. ya these things are just beer for bums to get buzzed in a blaze of time. Which i think makes it good for what it is, im just not lookin for it. on the ice beer scale, lower in terms of choice, if one had the options of course. not everyone is as fair as i.

Poured from an undated 12oz can.

On the pour a fizzy soda like head forms then quickly disappears entirely. Carbonation is very lively and the color is a yellow gold.

Aroma is rough. A bit of green apple off sweetness followed by a skunky note and finished by a rough bad smell that I couldn't say where it came from. Smells like expired cider even ice cold.

Flavor isuch better than the aroma fortunately with some malts actually present. Zero hops however. A fuel and alcohol flavor is present in the very back despite only being 5.5% abv. Has the same ricey light note as standard bud. Not the worst, bit not good. To be honest everything leading up to this had me expecting worse.

Feel is light watery and has a lot of co2 bite. Despite all its flaws, when ice cold this beer is relatively refreshing, and some head does form when sipped despite being headless in the glass. It gets the job done but it's still not great.

Overall this is just a cheaper stronger version of budweiser. If you like bud and are on a budget this might be fore you, but MHL is the same price and scores better in every category.

If I’m picking one 25 ounce beer to drink it’s between this or Budweiser. Similar to Bud in taste beechwood aged with stronger alcohol at 5.5 percent biting on your tongue overpowering. Decent smell when breathing through your nose. Not as enjoyable, but better buzz in a pinch.

25 oz. Can poured into mason jar
Look: Light straw, four finger head, heavy carbonation
Smell: Malt and corn sweetness
Taste: Bready with a hint of sweetness, little bitterness, strange finish- but not bad
Feel: A tongue tingler, light mouthfeel without being waterly
Overall: Nor too bad, but not special. Drinkable.

25oz can from Fred Meyers. Every once in a while I dip my toe into the pool of beers kept at the end of the cooler. Those enormous cans with miniscule prices. Beers for the masses. Rating beer means all beers, not just the good ones. So here we go....I would say it looks like piss, but a lot of beers do. Weak golden body, foamy head fizzes away. Aroma? Faint " beer" aroma ( remember college? Day old beer can empties?) Taste is weak grainy, malty flavors, but nothing horrific. Just not much of anything. Easily drinkable, would quench your thirst for sure. Just not a lot of flavor at all. I've had worse.

To those who pour this in a glass to observe the taste/feel/aroma that’s like trying connect your iPhone to a 68 mustang stock radio. Just isn’t made for that purpose lol. This is a good beer after you mow the lawn or need something crisp. A smoking beer or a game with the buddies beer. Would I drink it every day? No. Would I drink it when I need a low priced buzz? Heck yeah. That’s the main reason they sell it in 16 oz cans. Don’t drink this if you want a “fancy beer” or “reviewable” this is as common as a Pepsi and should be drank as so. Enjoy my friends.

This beer is get drunk, it even comes in 40 ounces so the teens who know someone who want to look cool on the railroad tracks or at a shitty party they don't realize that 40 ounces of bud ice is not how much you can drink but how fast. Ever drink warm bud ice? The ass end of a bottle? WOOF! I only bought a case of this because of the dam penguins and getting beer I was too young for during the early 90s ICE wars. Budweiser admitted that their employees used to piss into the vats. Now we know why it has such a bad flavor. PASS THIS UP!

12oz bottle - bought this because it's infamous, review from notes:

This lives up to the awful legends about it. The best way I can describe it, and I'm not trying to be vulgar, this is just the best way to sum it up: it tastes how piss smells. And I wish I was kidding. Slightly sweet with a bite of alcohol, too. I don't know if this is a bad bottle, or what, and I don't care

curiosity satisfied

Revisited this vile piss because l told my wife to grab me some beer. She must hate me. Looks is fine, pale golden yellow, leaving light lacing down the glass as it sits. Smells like, well, nothing good, really. Faint corn, stale wet bread, just not good. Taste is absolutely horrid. Slightly sweet, with an unpleasant bitterness. Not a hops bitter, but a wtf did l just put in my mouth bitter. Almost like someone put a cig out in this thing and put it back in the fridge. Mouthfeel is not horrid, and probably the best quality of this crap. Glad l had the opportunity to show the can to my wife and explain to her how she should never desecrate my fridge with this ever again. So many better brews at the same price point. Effing disgusting. Avoid... just terrible.

It's primary benefit is the price. It's very inexpensive. The beer itself is easy to drink and has decent carbonation. The smell of it may not be the best but if you can get past that it's a decent brew. I'm not a huge fan of ice brewed beer but this one is acceptable to my personal taste. I recommend trying it. Even just once.

Bud ice is the true godfather among the ice beer family. Doesn't taste the best but what do you expect. No other Ice beer goes down as smooth and feels as good as a few crisp bud ices. Best enjoyed in a bottle and with a pack of American Spirits after a long day. Has a nice vintage look that clearly has not been updated since the '90s.

People gotta remember this is an iced bud light, not bud regular. It's low in calories and flavor, less than bud regular but you get a higher abv with the refreshing bite of a bud a light. I'm down with it, esp from a clear bottle on a hot day

In the realm of ICE beers this is not bad the appearance is average smell average taste essentially like bud heavy with less bread taste and more of an Alcohol. Overall Average. I would not bother buying it for a party or any function. Would recommend just spending the extra 2-3 dollars a case and buy something better and crisper. For a ICE Beer I would recommend Labatt Maxx ICE over this.

Pours a piss yellow, classic among all cheap lagers, 1/2 inch frothy white head that leaves the glass quickly. Smells like straw & horse piss inside of a hay barn with a slight hint of malts. Taste certainly follows the nose, it is smooth, but it sure does leave a funky aftertaste. Full-bodied with a smooth finish. There is a reason why this beer is cheap & we all bought it for that reason. If it's ice cold it isn't all that bad.

Poured from a bottle in to a pint glass.
Appears golden yellow with a rocky foamy white head that dropped quickly to almost nothing.
Smells lightly malty.
Taste follows the nose.
Mouth feel is light.
Overall, there's better beers out there, but a free beer on a 100 degrees day? I would drink one.

This is the quintessential lazy summer night beer, the kind of drink you have with the boys over a bbq and a ball game. Nothing extraordinary, nothing offensive, just a clean and refreshing taste for those easy going nights.

Nothing quite singes the palette like that metallic Budweiser Ice flavor. Brewed for that fantastic can smoothness for an ice cold finish and a life ending hangover! After a few you’ll know it, both from the alcohol and the brick that is now in your stomach. The taste of a metal street pole will linger for a while, as will the masonry in your gut. Not advised for a drinking game, but it will get ya drunk. That’s about all it has going for it.

Ice cold (obviously) is the way to go for this one. This is my favorite ice brew edging out Beast Ice by a hair. Paid $1.19. Doesn’t smell like much and it’s smooth as hell. It’s kinda carbonated but not as much as say High Life. Give it a shot cause if you don’t like you’re out a dollar and some change. Drink it cold and you’ll enjoy it, cheers.

My local wing place has these for $1 a can, 24/7. Love drinking a couple while eating wings and fries and such. Perfect pairing.

I wouldn't drink at home, but when had at a bar with friends and good food, can't beat it.

I see all the low ratings and then some of the higher ratings since this is a cheaper beer.
Butttt….. for those people who are trying to watch their carb intake, have you seen Busch Light has only 3.2g carbs???? When comparing it to Corona Premiere and Yuengling Flight at 2.6g, and then comparing the price… Busch Light is a steal!!! And truly, the flavor is pretty good!!
Pretty bad. It's appropriately light, but has a grain profile that tastes like they used expired materials. There's no reason to drink this crap when Hamm's exists. Don't do it to yourself.

Terrible beer but not the worst I’ve ever had. I broke down and bought two 25oz cans on the suggestion of a trusted friend who has a similar taste in beers and food as I do. I still trust him but I have no idea what he sees in this beer other than it’s rock-bottom price. He told me that he buys this beer to give to house guests that refuse to bring their own beer due to its cheapness and that it’s a great lean mowing beer that “tastes like nothing” and doesn’t ruin the palate for drinking craft beer later. Well. It doesn’t taste like nothing. It tastes like aluminum. It tastes like the damn can it’s in. Next time I’ll go with Bud Light.

It's better than Bud Light. This is as close to sparkling water as a beer can get, barely any flavor but still edges out some of the other light beers out there just due to how chuggable it is. If you just want to get drunk this will do.

16 oz. Can poured into Imperial Pint
Look: Nearly transparent straw, Heavy carbonation, 2-finger creamy head which quickly dissipated, some lacing
Aroma: Bready, crisp, pleasant but one-note
Taste: Malt forward, not as watery as I expected, some complexity
Feel: Excellent mouthfeel, flavor lingers.
Overall: Straight forward light beer, has enough flavor to make it drinkable.
Pair with fried food, pasta, pizza and light cheese.
It tastes good only after you brush your teeth with mint toothpaste. Other than that, it's pretty bad. There's certainly worse beer out there, but not many.

12oz can
